subject: Politics
title: Democratic Backsliding
description: A short lesson to help you apply Democratic Backsliding.

hook.text: Democracy is retreating worldwide. More countries are losing freedom than gaining it. The trend is alarming.

buildup.text: Democratic backsliding means elected leaders gradually erode democratic norms, courts, and press freedom.

discovery.text: Freedom House reports that global freedom has declined for 17 consecutive years. The democratic recession is real.

twist.text: Backsliding is subtle. Leaders don't cancel elections â€” they rig them. They don't ban media â€” they buy it.

climax.text: Turkey, Hungary, India, and Brazil all show how elected leaders can hollow out democracy from within.

punchline.text: Democracy dies slowly. The erosion is quiet until it's too late.

quiz.question: How does democratic backsliding typically occur?
options: Elected leaders gradually erode norms, courts, and press freedom
Foreign armies invade and impose authoritarian rule
Citizens voluntarily abandon democracy in referendums
